# GKVoiceChat

**Class**

A voice channel that allows players to speak with each other in a multiplayer game.

## Declaration

```swift
class GKVoiceChat
```

## Overview

GameKit provides the underlying mechanism to implement voice chat between players in a multiplayer game. It’s your responsibility to provide player controls and display feedback during the chat.

First, configure voice chat by adding the [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/BundleResources/Information-Property-List/NSMicrophoneUsageDescription] key to the Information Property List and creating an audio session. Then, create a `GKVoiceChat` object using the `GKMatch` [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKMatch/voiceChat(withName:)] method passing a string that identifies the voice channel. Use the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKVoiceChat/start()] method to connect players to the channel. Use the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKVoiceChat/isActive] property to activate the microphone or switch the microphone between channels.

Provide a handler using the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKVoiceChat/playerVoiceChatStateDidChangeHandler] property to update the interface when a player connects, speaks, or disconnects from a chat. You can also add controls that mute and set the volume using the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKVoiceChat/setPlayer(_:muted:)] method and [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKVoiceChat/volume] property.

Note that if there’s insufficient bandwidth over Wi-Fi to maintain a voice chat, GameKit may disconnect players from the channel or disband a channel.

## Determining Whether Voice Chat Is Available

- **isVoIPAllowed()**: Returns whether voice chat is available on the device.

## Starting and Stopping Voice Chat

- **start()**: Starts communication with other players in a channel.
- **stop()**: Ends communication with other players in a channel.
- **isActive**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the channel is sampling the microphone.

## Receiving Updates About Other Participants

- **playerVoiceChatStateDidChangeHandler**: A method that handles when a player’s voice chat changes state.
- **GKVoiceChat.PlayerState**: The state of a player in a voice chat.

## Controlling Chat Volume

- **setPlayer(_:muted:)**: Mutes a player in the chat, including the local player.
- **volume**: The volume level for the channel.

## Accessing Properties

- **name**: The name of the voice chat channel.
- **players**: The players connected to the channel.

## Deprecated Methods and Properties

- **playerIDs**: An array of strings containing the player identifiers for the players connected to the channel.
- **playerStateUpdateHandler**: Handles when a player in the chat changes state.
- **setMute(_:forPlayer:)**: Mutes a player in a voice chat.

## Deprecated classes

- **GKAchievementViewController**: An `GKAchievementViewController` object provides a standard user interface to display achievement progress for the local player. If the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKGameCenterViewController] class is available, you should use it instead.
- **GKChallengeEventHandler**: The `GKChallengeEventHandler` class is used to respond to events related to challenges sent or received by the local player.
- **GKChallengesViewController**
- **GKChallenge**: A challenge issued by the local player to another player.
- **GKScoreChallenge**: A type of challenge where a player must beat the leaderboard score of another player.
- **GKAchievementChallenge**: A type of challenge where a player must earn another player’s achievement.
- **GKCloudPlayer**: The object representing the currently signed-in iCloud user.
- **GKGameCenterViewController**: The dashboard that allows players to access their Game Center data in your game.
- **GKGameSession**: A game session you can use to save game data, invite other players, and create turn-based and real-time game apps.
- **GKGameSessionSharingViewController**: A user interface you can use to invite other users into a tvOS game session.
- **GKFriendRequestComposeViewController**: Your game uses the `GKFriendRequestComposeViewController` class to present a screen that allows the local player to send friend requests to other players.
- **GKLeaderboardViewController**: The `GKLeaderboardViewController` class provides a standard user interface that displays leaderboard scores to the player. If the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKGameCenterViewController] class is available, you should use it instead.
- **GKPeerPickerController**: Provides a standard user interface to allow one iOS device to discover and connect to another.
- **GKScore**: An object containing information for a score that was earned by the player.
- **GKSession**: A [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKSession] object provides the ability to discover and connect to nearby iOS devices using Bluetooth or Wi-fi.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
